channel.title: Police on City of San Diego Open Data Portal
channel.description: Recent content in Police on City of San Diego Open Data Portal

item.title: Hate Crimes
item.description: Hate crimes reported to the San Diego Police Department.

item.title: Police Beats
item.description: San Diego Police Department beats.

item.title: Police Calls for Service
item.description: Calls dispatched by the San Diego Police Department’s communications dispatch center.

item.title: Police Calls for Service Call Types
item.description: Call type codes used by the San Diego Police Department’s communications dispatch center. This is a reference dataset for Police Calls for Service.

item.title: Police Calls for Service Disposition Codes
item.description: Call disposition codes used by the San Diego Police Department’s communications dispatch center. This is a reference dataset for Police Calls for Service.

item.title: Police divisions
item.description: The City has 9 divisions for the purpose of law enforcement: Central, Northern, Northeastern, Northwestern, Southern, Southeastern, Easter, Western, and Mid-City. Each division is a combination of law beat areas within the division boundary. These are police divisions only and do not represent legal neighborhood or community boundaries.

item.title: Police neighborhoods
item.description: Law beat areas for the purpose of law enforcement within the City. These combine into larger police divisions. These boundaries are for law enforcement only and do not represent legal neighborhood or community boundaries.

item.title: Police Vehicle Stops
item.description: Vehicle stops made by the San Diego Police Department between 2014 and June 26, 2018. For stops made after June 26, 2018, please see the Police RIPA Stops dataset.

item.title: Police Vehicle Stops Search Details
item.description: Details on searches conducted during vehicle stops as well as outcomes for stops made by the San Diego Police Department between 2014 and June 26, 2018. For stops made after June 26, 2018, please see the Police RIPA Stops datasets.

item.title: RIPA police stop data - actions taken
item.description: Actions an officer took toward a person stopped by the San Diego Police Department. This data is collected according to requirements set forth in Government Code section 12525.5 that was enacted as a result of the Racial and Identity Profiling Act of 2015 (AB 953), also known as RIPA.

item.title: RIPA police stop data - basic details
item.description: All stops made by the San Diego Police Department. Data collected from these stops conforms to requirements set forth in Government Code section 12525.5 that was enacted as a result of the Racial and Identity Profiling Act of 2015 (AB 953). RIPA stops data collection began on July 1, 2018. Data on stops made before July is limited to vehicle stops and can be found in the police vehicle stops dataset

item.title: RIPA police stop data - basis for property seizure
item.description: Basis for seizing property from persons stopped by the San Diego Police Department. This data is collected according to requirements set forth in Government Code section 12525.5 that was enacted as a result of the Racial and Identity Profiling Act of 2015 (AB 953), also known as RIPA.

item.title: RIPA police stop data - basis for searches conducted
item.description: The basis for any search conducted as part of stop by the San Diego Police Department. This data is collected according to requirements set forth in Government Code section 12525.5 that was enacted as a result of the Racial and Identity Profiling Act of 2015 (AB 953), also known as RIPA.

item.title: RIPA police stop data - contraband and/or evidence found
item.description: Type of contraband or evidence found during a stop by the San Diego Police Department. This data is collected according to requirements set forth in Government Code section 12525.5 that was enacted as a result of the Racial and Identity Profiling Act of 2015 (AB 953), also known as RIPA.

item.title: RIPA police stop data - disability of persons stopped
item.description: Whether a person stopped by the San Diego Police Department displayed signs of deafness, speech impairment, blindness, a mental health condition, intellectual or developmental disability, or another disability categorized as “other.” This data is collected according to requirements set forth in Government Code section 12525.5 that was enacted as a result of the Racial and Identity Profiling Act of 2015 (AB 953), also known as RIPA.

item.title: RIPA police stop data - gender of persons stopped
item.description: The gender of persons stopped by the San Diego Police Department, as perceived by the officer conducting the stop. This data is collected according to requirements set forth in Government Code section 12525.5 that was enacted as a result of the Racial and Identity Profiling Act of 2015 (AB 953), also known as RIPA.

item.title: RIPA police stop data - property seized
item.description: Type of property seized from persons stopped by the San Diego Police Department. This data is collected according to requirements set forth in Government Code section 12525.5 that was enacted as a result of the Racial and Identity Profiling Act of 2015 (AB 953), also known as RIPA.

item.title: RIPA police stop data - race of persons stopped
item.description: The race of persons stopped by the San Diego Police Department, as perceived by the officer conducting the stop. This data is collected according to requirements set forth in Government Code section 12525.5 that was enacted as a result of the Racial and Identity Profiling Act of 2015 (AB 953), also known as RIPA.

item.title: RIPA police stop data - reason for stop
item.description: The primary reason a person was stopped by the San Diego Police Department. This data is collected according to requirements set forth in Government Code section 12525.5 that was enacted as a result of the Racial and Identity Profiling Act of 2015 (AB 953), also known as RIPA.

item.title: RIPA police stop data - result of stop
item.description: The outcome(s) of a stop for a person stopped by the San Diego Police Department. This data is collected according to requirements set forth in Government Code section 12525.5 that was enacted as a result of the Racial and Identity Profiling Act of 2015 (AB 953), also known as RIPA.

item.title: Traffic collisions
item.description: Traffic collision reports within the City of San Diego.
